biography: Beth Gibbons (born 4 January 1965) is an English singer and songwriter best known as the singer and lyricist for the English band Portishead. With Adrian Utley, Gibbons and Barrow released the first Portishead album, Dummy, in 1994 and have produced two other studio albums, a live album, and various singles in the years since. She has also collaborated on a separate project with former Talk Talk bassist Paul Webb (Rustin Man). (Before she joined Geoff Barrow in Portishead, she auditioned for the singer's slot in .O.rang, the group formed by Webb after Talk Talk's late-Eighties departure from EMI, but Portishead's sudden success pre-empted matters.) In October 2002, they released the album Out of Season in the United Kingdom. The album peaked at number 28 in the UK Albums Chart. It was released in the United States a year later.
name: Beth Gibbons

theaudiodb.biography_en: Beth Gibbons (born 4 January 1965) is an English singer and songwriter best known as the singer and lyricist for the English band Portishead. With Adrian Utley, Gibbons and Barrow released the first Portishead album, Dummy, in 1994 and have produced two other studio albums, a live album, and various singles in the years since. She has also collaborated on a separate project with former Talk Talk bassist Paul Webb (Rustin Man). (Before she joined Geoff Barrow in Portishead, she auditioned for the singer's slot in .O.rang, the group formed by Webb after Talk Talk's late-Eighties departure from EMI, but Portishead's sudden success pre-empted matters.) In October 2002, they released the album Out of Season in the United Kingdom. The album peaked at number 28 in the UK Albums Chart. It was released in the United States a year later.
theaudiodb.name: Beth Gibbons

lastfm.bio_content: Beth Gibbons (born 4 January 1965, in Exeter, United Kingdom) is best known as the vocalist and front woman for the trip hop band Portishead. With Portishead, Gibbons released two studio albums and a live album in the 1990s, followed by a third studio album in 2008. Gibbons has also collaborated on a separate project with former Talk Talk member Paul Webb a.k.a. Rustin Man. The Beth Gibbons & Rustin Man album, Out of Season, came out in 2002. 2024 saw Gibbons' début as a solo recording artist in her own right. The album Lives Outgrown came out on 17 May of that year, to universal acclaim. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

She has also collaborated on a separate project with former Talk Talk bassist Paul Webb (Rustin Man).
